medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive erythematous nodules on bilateral or unilateral lower extremities.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patients presented with symptoms ranging from 1 year to 3 months. The first patient had a progressive nodular eruption associated with bilateral lower-extremity edema that developed over several months. The second patient experienced leg edema, pruritus, and purple discoloration for 9 months, with recent development of tender papules. The third patient reported red nodules on her amputation stump for 3 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: pre-existing peripheral edema, peripheral vascular disease, stasis dermatitis, hypertension, mild diabetes mellitus, rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, hypertension, congestive heart failure, Alzheimer's dementia, peptic ulcer disease, urosepsis.
medical_history.social_history: Patient 1 worked in oil mining; Patient 3 worked in dry cleaning. All patients denied toxic exposures.
